addColumnFormulaCell

public org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFCell addColumnFormulaCell(int rowIndex,
                                                                   int columnIndex,
                                                                   int firstDataRowIndex,
                                                                   int lastDataRowIndex,
                                                                   Style style,
                                                                   String function)
Creates a formula cell. Example: to create a sum cell on

Parameters:
rowIndex - The index (rownumber - 1) of the row into which the formula should be placed
columnIndex - The index of the column into which the formula should be placed
firstDataRowIndex - The index of the row that starts the range
lastDataRowIndex - The index of the row that ends the range
style - The style of the cell containing the formula
function - The function to be applied.
Returns:

addColumnFormulaReferenceCell

public org.apache.poi.hssf.usermodel.HSSFCell addColumnFormulaReferenceCell(int rowIndex,
                                                                            int columnIndex,
                                                                            int firstDataRowIndex,
                                                                            int lastDataRowIndex,
                                                                            Style style,
                                                                            String function)
Creates a formula cell. Example: to create a sum cell on SUMIF(C2:C107;"B";I2:I107)+SUMIF(C2:C107;"I";I2:I107) SUMIF(${OC_DESIGNATOR};"B";${CORE_REPORT})+SUMIF(${OC_DESIGNATOR};"I";${ CORE_REPORT}) VLOOKUP(lookup_value, table_array, col_index_num, range_lookup) VLOOKUP("B", A2:Q107, 2, FALSE)

Parameters:
rowIndex - The index (rownumber - 1) of the row into which the formula should be placed
columnIndex - The index of the column into which the formula should be placed
firstDataRowIndex - The index of the row that starts the range
lastDataRowIndex - The index of the row that ends the rang
style - The style of the cell containing the formula
function - The function to be applied.
Returns:

Creates a formula cell based on parameters given for location of that cell. Example: addFormulaCell(column.getWorkbookFormula(), columnIndexByName, column.getColumnName(), rowIndex, columnIndex)
